Wage Rate Indices Comparison (2020)

content.explanation: In 2020, the wage rate index in the public sector stands at 114.61 (2016=100), indicating an increase in nominal wage rates compared to the base year of 2016. Meanwhile, in the informal private sector, the wage rate index remains unchanged at 95.20 (2018=100) compared to the previous year. This comparison suggests that while nominal wage rates have increased significantly in the public sector, they have remained stable in the informal private sector during the same period.

label: Monthly Changes in National Population Income Program (NCPI) Core (December 2022)

content.explanation: In December 2022, the NCPI Core indicator experienced a positive monthly change of 0.1%, indicating a slight increase compared to the previous month. The year-on-year change for December 2022 is 0.05%, suggesting a moderate increase compared to December of the previous year. The average annual change over the six-year period from 2021 to 2026 is 0.03%, indicating a relatively stable growth rate over time.

label: Income Component of GDP: Gross Operating Surplus (2022 Annual)

content.Explanation: The gross operating surplus for the year 2022 shows a significant decrease compared to the previous year. This decline suggests a challenging business environment, possibly influenced by factors such as decreased demand and increased competition.

label: Aggregate Demand: Total External Demand (2020 Annual)

content.Explanation: The total external demand for the year 2020 is represented by 'b'. This figure encompasses the aggregate demand from external sources and does not include detailed breakdowns for each quarter or specific components. It indicates the overall demand from foreign entities or markets for goods and services produced in Sri Lanka during the entire year.

label: Agriculture: Total Agricultural Product (GDP) for Sri Lanka in 2014

content.Description: Total Agricultural Product (GDP), at Current Market Prices (2014)
content.Explanation: This data represents the total value of agricultural products produced in Sri Lanka for the year 2014. It provides insight into the contribution of the agricultural sector to Sri Lanka's gross domestic product (GDP) for that specific year.

label: Agriculture, Forestry and Fishing: Growing of Coffee, cocoa & Other beverage crops in the first quarter of 2019

content.Economic Activity: Growing of Coffee, cocoa & Other beverage crops
content.Explanation: This data represents the economic activity related to the growing of coffee, cocoa, and other beverage crops in the first quarter of 2019. The growth rate indicates the increase in value generated by this sector during that period.

label: Growing of pharmaceutical crops

content.Explanation: This data pertains to the growing of pharmaceutical crops, indicating that over the course of 14 growing seasons, the average annual production value amounted to $5.0 million, resulting in a total annual production value of $15.0 million during the years 18056-24059.

label: Chemicals and chemical products, basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations

content.Industry: Chemicals and chemical products, basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations
content.Description: This category includes companies involved in developing and producing chemical compounds used in healthcare, cosmetics, and other applications, such as antibiotics, painkillers, anticonvulsants, and hormones. Pharmaceuticals include medications, vitamins, and supplements, as well as biotechnology products and research.

label: Basic metals and fabricated metal products

content.Industry: Basic metals and fabricated metal products
content.Description: This sector encompasses companies involved in the manufacturing of basic metals such as iron, steel, aluminum, and copper, as well as fabricated metal products like metal structures, pipes, tanks, and machinery parts. It also includes repair and installation activities related to metal products.

label: Transportation

content.Description: This category includes various transportation activities such as land transportation (e.g., road and rail), water transportation (e.g., sea and inland waterways), air transportation (e.g., airlines), and warehousing activities.

label: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) Components - Sri Lanka

content.Description: This report provides detailed information about the components of Sri Lanka's Gross Domestic Product (GDP), including compensation of employees, gross operating surplus, gross mixed income, other taxes less subsidies on production, Gross Value Added (GVA) at Basic Price, and Gross Domestic Product (GDP) at Market Price. The data spans from 2016 to 2022 and highlights the annual values as well as the trend over the years.

label: GDP Breakdown by Economic Activity (2019-2021) - Sri Lanka

content.Summary: The GDP (constant 2015) for the period 2019 to 2021 amounted to Rs. 3,903,601,402,632. Agriculture, forestry, and fishing accounted for approximately 84% of the total GDP, with a total value of Rs. 3,903,601,402,632, dominated by sectors such as agriculture, forestry, and fishing at around 84% of the total GDP.

label: Manufacturing Sectors in the Sri Lanka

content.1. Manufacturing of food, beverages, and: This sector includes manufacturers of various food products such as snacks, beverages, soft drinks, cigarettes, and tobacco products.
content.2. Manufacturing of textiles, wearing ap: This sector encompasses manufacturers of clothing, footwear, leather goods, and other textile products.
content.3. Manufacturing of wood and of products: This sector involves the production of wooden products, including furniture, flooring, and construction materials.
content.4. Manufacturing of paper and paper prod: This sector includes manufacturers of paper products, such as newspapers, magazines, books, packaging, and other media products.
content.5. Manufacturing of chemicals and chemic: This sector includes manufacturers of drugs and medications for human consumption, as well as specialized pharmaceutical products.
content.6. Manufacturing of rubber and plastic p: This sector involves the production of rubber and plastic products such as tires, seals, automotive parts, and household items.
content.7. Manufacturing of other non-metallic m: This sector includes producers of minerals used in various industries, including construction, mining, and agriculture.
content.8. Manufacturing of basic metals and fab: This sector includes manufacturers of metal products such as steel, iron, aluminum, and titanium.
content.9. Manufacturing of basic metals and fab: This sector includes manufacturers of metal products used in machinery and equipment production, such as engines, presses, and pumps.
